article:
Several years after Ivy Priest was appointed treasurer   of the United States, she returned to her hometown. The warm welcome she received made her think of her teenage   _  .
When Ivy was a teenager, she had pictured herself returning after achieving   _   and fortune. Secretly she had dreamed of becoming a (n)   _  . So when she learned that roles in a movie to be   _   in Salt Lake City would be given to those who   _   the largest number of subscriptions to a newspaper, Ivy went to work. She tried her best and won second prize. This     _   her the chance of dancing in a beautiful dress during a short   _   in the movie. The night the movie was to be shown,   _   kept her from eating. But when she saw herself on the screen, acting   _  , she slipped out of the theater and went home to   _   herself to sleep.  
However, Ivy was not to be defeated by that. She became interested in politics at high school and wanted to study   _   after graduation, but her family could not afford to send her to college. To   _   her own expenses, Ivy had to work as a ticket   _   during the day and a telephone operator at night.   Even so  , Ivy had the dream of achieving fame and fortune.
Ivy's interest in politics   _   her down a new path. She took part in a lot of challenging activities of the Republican Party,   _   which was her extraordinary effort in helping Eisenhower   _   the presidential election. Mr Eisenhower said to Ivy, "I   _   you to be the treasurer of the United States."
Ivy was born into a (n)   _   family, but her dreams, her faith and her hard work   _   her a life of success.
